page.title: 08Farming on the Fylde Coast
page.content: Farms in area vary in size between 50 to 300 acres,mainly family run with little paid labour,and almost entirely permanent grassland with few cereals grown.EEC milk production quotas from l984 has made some farms unviable thus when sold they are bought by neighbours,land and quotas shared. Vacant possession land is worth around Â£2000 & Â£2500 per acre depending on state of farm.Rental values are approx Â£40 per acre.The predominant black & white British Friesian cattle average 5000-6500 litres per lactation.A few farms have lambing sheep producing fat lambs.There is an intensive pig unit and 2 medium sized poultry units. Animal rights people object to intensive livestock. Conservationists are vociferous about countryside & overproduction of Food in E.E.C.,which is leading to restrictions in output.
